text: <s>[INST] What are the key co-curricular opportunities available for ECE students at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Georgia Tech offers a variety of co-curricular opportunities for ECE students, including student organizations like IEEE Georgia Tech Chapter, Vertically Integrated Projects (VIP) Program, Opportunity Research Scholars (ORS) Program, ECE Research Opportunities, Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program (UROP), ECE Transfer Initiative for Engineering Scholars (TIES), Engineering for Social Innovation Center (ESI), Create-X, Grand Challenges, and InVenture Prize. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the program objectives for the Computer Engineering degree at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The program objectives for the Computer Engineering degree are to prepare graduates to be leaders in professional practice, adaptive learners, innovative through advanced education, and problem solvers considering global, societal, and environmental impact. They are also trained to lead and participate in diverse teams and promote a broad range of perspectives in developing solutions. </s>

<s>[INST] How can I make an appointment to see an ECE advisor at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Appointments with ECE advisors at Georgia Tech can be made through AdvisorLink. Check the calendars for available time slots and verify if the appointment is in the office or online. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the minimum GPA requirement to meet degree requirements at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Students must earn a C or better in all CS, MATH, PHYS, and ECE required courses, and any required courses from a thread. Georgia Tech requires a minimum GPA of 2.0 to graduate. </s>

<s>[INST] How does research count towards an ECE degree at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Up to 6 hours of research can count towards FREE electives for an ECE degree. If a student opts for the research option with a thesis, 9 hours of research can count towards the degree. Additionally, 3 hours of ECE 4699 may apply to one EE thread elective requiring an ECE 3000/4000 level elective. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the potential career paths for a graduate in the Cybersecurity thread of Computer Engineering? [/INST] Career paths in the Cybersecurity thread include Hardware Security Engineer, Side Channel Engineer, Software Threat Analyst, and Software Security Engineer, with roles in design, analysis, and research on secure cyber systems. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the process for changing my major at Georgia Tech? [/INST] To change your major at Georgia Tech, complete the change of major form for undergraduate students through the Registrar’s DocuSign application. The form goes to the new major school first and then your current major for approval. </s>

<s>[INST] What courses are available in the Telecommunications thread for Electrical Engineering students? [/INST] Courses in the Telecommunications thread include ECE 2026 (Intro Signal Processing), ECE 3600 (Computer Communications), ECE 4601 (Communication Systems), ECE 4606 (Wireless Communications), and several others focusing on communication engineering principles and technologies. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the grade substitution policy at Georgia Tech? [/INST] At Georgia Tech, students who earn a D or F in a course may repeat it within a year and apply for grade substitution. The initial grade remains on the transcript, but its quality points are no longer averaged into the GT GPA. This can be done twice during the undergraduate academic career. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the senior design completion options for EE and CMPE majors at Georgia Tech? [/INST] EE and CMPE majors at Georgia Tech can complete senior design through a two-semester ECE team project, a single semester ECE team project, or a single semester multidisciplinary team project. Each option has specific course numbers and prerequisites. </s>

[/INST] EE and CMPE majors at Georgia Tech can complete senior design through a two-semester ECE team project, a single semester ECE team project, or a single semester multidisciplinary team project. Each option has specific course numbers and prerequisites. </s>

<s>[INST] Can ECE students take courses on a pass-fail basis at Georgia Tech? [/INST] ECE students at Georgia Tech can take humanities, social sciences (except ECON requirement), science elective for EE majors, and approved/free electives on a pass-fail basis. Specific ECE courses like ECE 1100 and ECE 3005 are also offered only on a pass-fail basis. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the degree requirements for the Dual BS in Computer Engineering at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The Dual BS in Computer Engineering allows students to earn a BSEE degree from KAIST and a BSEE or BSCmpE from Georgia Tech, involving two years of study at each institution with lectures given in English. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Cooperative Plan at Georgia Tech and how does it integrate with the ECE program? [/INST] The Cooperative Plan at Georgia Tech combines classroom study with practical work experience related to the student's major. It alternates semesters of on-campus study with full-time employment, starting as early as the freshman or sophomore year. The degree requirements are the same for co-op students as for other ECE majors. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the International Plan in ECE at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The International Plan in ECE at Georgia Tech is designed for students seeking an intensive international experience, integrating coursework, language study, and residential overseas experience. It results in a designation on the student's transcript and diploma. </s>

<s>[INST] How does the Research Option in ECE at Georgia Tech work? [/INST] The Research Option in ECE at Georgia Tech offers a concentrated research experience culminating in an undergraduate thesis. It includes structured research over three or four semesters, with a required Web-based research portfolio. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the potential career paths for graduates from the Robotics and Autonomous Systems thread in ECE? [/INST] Career paths include industrial robots, medical robots, assistive robots, autonomous vehicles, automation, aerospace industry, defense industry, microcontroller industry, and research labs. </s>

<s>[INST] How can ECE students at Georgia Tech declare a minor? [/INST] Most minors are approved by sending the minor form through DocuSign to be signed by the minor school and the major school. Some minors require an additional application, and CMPE majors following the thread curriculum are not eligible for a CS minor. </s>

<s>[INST] What courses are available in the Information Internetworks thread for Computer Engineering students? [/INST] Courses include CS 2340 - Objects and Design, CS 3510/3511 - Design and Analysis of Algorithms, CS 4235 - Introduction to Information Security, CS 4400 - Introduction to Database Systems, and several advanced information management courses. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the career prospects for graduates in the Computing Hardware & Emerging Architectures thread? [/INST] Graduates can pursue careers in computer chip and digital system design, smart phones and mobile platforms, cloud and edge computing, cybersecurity, high-performance computing, and emerging computing technologies like quantum and neuromorphic computing. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Grand Challenges program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The Grand Challenges Living Learning Community at Georgia Tech is a program for students of any major, focusing on student-driven, cross-disciplinary teams investigating societally relevant technological and sociological problems. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the InVenture Prize at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The InVenture Prize at Georgia Tech, nicknamed 'American Idol for Nerds,' is an interdisciplinary innovation competition open to all undergraduate students and recent graduates, fostering innovation and entrepreneurship. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Vertically Integrated Projects (VIP) Program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The VIP Program at Georgia Tech unites undergraduate education with faculty research in a team-based context. Students earn academic credits through participation, contributing to design and discovery efforts. </s>

<s>[INST] How does the ECE Transfer Initiative for Engineering Scholars (TIES) program work at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Funded by the NSF S-STEM Program, TIES aids students transferring from two- and four-year schools majoring in electrical or computer engineering, offering both enrichment programs and scholarships. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the key features of the Create-X program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] CREATE-X is a collection of programs at Georgia Tech designed to boost students' entrepreneurial confidence and provide tools for establishing startups. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the focus of the Engineering for Social Innovation Center (ESI) at Georgia Tech? [/INST] ESI at Georgia Tech focuses on projects aimed at improving the lives of the underprivileged in the domestic population or developing world, engaging undergraduates in interdisciplinary research and development. </s>

<s>[INST] How does the Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program (UROP) function in ECE at Georgia Tech? [/INST] UROP offers students the chance to work on individual research projects with ECE faculty, and those who complete both semesters can count the 3 credit hours as ECE elective hours. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the ECE Research Opportunities website at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The website hosts open research positions in ECE related fields for undergraduate and graduate students, listing current ECE research labs and opportunities. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the significance of the Grand Challenges Living Learning Community at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Established in 2012, this program promotes student-driven, cross-disciplinary teams to investigate societally relevant technological and sociological problems, open to all Georgia Tech students. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the structure of the BS/MS Electrical and Computer Engineering program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] This program allows qualified students to receive both the Bachelor of Science and a master's degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering, broadening their studies and improving career prospects. </s>

<s>[INST] What does the Dual BS in Computer Engineering entail at Georgia Tech? [/INST] This program allows students to earn a BSEE degree from KAIST and a BSEE or BSCmpE from Georgia Tech, spending two years at each institution, with lectures in English. </s>

<s>[INST] What courses are included in the Distributed Systems & Software Design thread for Computer Engineering at Georgia Tech? [/INST] This thread includes courses like CS 3251 (Computer Networking), CS 4220 (Programming Embedded Systems), ECE 4122 (Advanced Programming Techniques), ECE 4795 (GPU Programming for Video Games), and several others focusing on software systems creation. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the potential career paths for students specializing in the Devices thread in Computer Engineering? [/INST] Career opportunities include roles in embedded computational artifact creation, such as cell phones, robots, jet engines, and intelligent appliances, spanning various industries and technological domains. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the focus of the Information Internetworks thread in the Computer Engineering program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The Information Internetworks thread deals with personal and organizational information management, preparing students for roles in information management across geographically distributed multi-national organizations. </s>

<s>[INST] What does the Systems & Architecture thread entail in the Computer Engineering program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] This thread covers the organization of computer systems, teaching about hardware and software layers, programming interfaces, and system properties like performance, power consumption, and security. </s>

<s>[INST] What kind of research opportunities are available in the Telecommunications thread for Electrical Engineering at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The Telecommunications thread prepares students for engineering and optimizing communication systems supporting data flows, focusing on principles and technologies from data storage to wireless and optics. </s>

<s>[INST] How does the Signal & Information Processing thread contribute to the Electrical Engineering program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] This thread focuses on data representations of physical events, playing a critical role in modern digital experiences and powering entertainment and technology of the future. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the career prospects for graduates from the Bioengineering thread in Electrical Engineering? [/INST] Graduates can explore opportunities in the medical device industry, consumer electronics for health, medical instrumentation, wearable tech, AI for health, digital health, bioelectronic medicine, and research institutes. </s>

<s>[INST] What does the Sensing & Exploration thread in Electrical Engineering at Georgia Tech focus on? [/INST] This thread deals with the creation of sensors and exploration technologies for various applications, from radars detecting remote objects to medical sensors observing human health conditions. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Electric Energy Systems thread about in the Electrical Engineering program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] This thread focuses on advancements in the production, distribution, and use of electrical power and energy, exploring smart grids, power electronics, electric machines, and secure control approaches. </s>

<s>[INST] What does the Electronic & Optoelectronic Devices thread offer in the Electrical Engineering curriculum at Georgia Tech? [/INST] It prepares students to design and manufacture nano-scale devices used in complex circuitry for various functionalities like computation, sensing, and communications. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the career opportunities for graduates in the 'Computing Hardware & Emerging Architectures' thread of Computer Engineering at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Graduates can pursue careers in computer chip design, computer architecture, smart phones and mobile platforms, cloud and edge computing, emerging computing technologies like quantum computing, cybersecurity, high-performance computing, and green computing. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the focus of the 'Robotics and Autonomous Systems' thread in Electrical Engineering at Georgia Tech? [/INST] This thread prepares students for careers in designing systems that combine sensing, computation, and actuation in feedback loops, applicable in diverse areas like space, air and ground vehicles, robotics, and automation. </s>

<s>[INST] How does the 'Research Option' in Electrical and Computer Engineering at Georgia Tech enhance a student's academic experience? [/INST] The Research Option offers a concentrated research experience, culminating in an undergraduate thesis. It includes structured research over three or four semesters, allowing students to deeply engage in their areas of interest. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the significance of the 'Signal & Information Processing' thread in the Electrical Engineering program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The 'Signal & Information Processing' thread is crucial for understanding and analyzing data representations of physical events, enhancing communication capabilities and influencing modern digital experiences. </s>

<s>[INST] What does the 'Electric Energy Systems' thread in Electrical Engineering at Georgia Tech focus on? [/INST] This thread is about advancements in electrical power production, distribution, and usage, focusing on smart grids, power electronics, electric machines, and sustainable energy systems. </s>

<s>[INST] How does the 'Electronic & Optoelectronic Devices' thread contribute to the Electrical Engineering curriculum at Georgia Tech? [/INST] It focuses on designing and manufacturing nano-scale devices for various applications like computation, sensing, and communications, contributing significantly to electronics and optoelectronics. </s>

<s>[INST] What opportunities does the 'Bioengineering' thread in Electrical Engineering provide at Georgia Tech? [/INST] It offers career prospects in medical device industry, health-related consumer electronics, medical instrumentation, wearable technology, AI for health, and bioelectronic medicine. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the benefits of the 'Telecommunications' thread in Electrical Engineering at Georgia Tech? [/INST] This thread offers in-depth knowledge and skills for engineering communication systems, focusing on mobile communications, satellite communications, Wi-Fi technology, wireless sensor networks, and autonomous vehicles. </s>

<s>[INST] How can a student change their major to Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering at Georgia Tech? [/INST] To change their major to EE or CMPE, students must be enrolled for at least one semester, have a minimum GPA of 2.70, meet specific course requirements, and complete the change of major form through the Registrar’s DocuSign application. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the grade substitution policy for undergraduate students at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Undergraduates at Georgia Tech can substitute grades for up to two courses where they initially earned a D or F, within a year of the first attempt. The original grade remains on the transcript, but does not count in the GPA. </s>

<s>[INST] What senior design completion options are available for EE and CMPE majors at Georgia Tech? [/INST] EE and CMPE majors can complete senior design through a two-semester ECE team project, a single semester ECE team project, or a single semester multidisciplinary team project, each with specific course requirements. </s>

<s>[INST] How does the Cooperative Plan work in conjunction with the ECE program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The Cooperative Plan integrates practical work experience related to a student's major with their academic studies, alternating semesters of full-time employment with on-campus study, starting as early as freshman or sophomore year. </s>

<s>[INST] What does the International Plan in ECE at Georgia Tech involve? [/INST] The International Plan develops global competence through coursework, language study, and residential overseas experience, resulting in a designation on the student's transcript and diploma. </s>

<s>[INST] How are research opportunities integrated into the ECE undergraduate program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Research opportunities, such as the Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program (UROP), allow students to work on individual research projects with faculty, and potentially count towards elective credits in their degree. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the various co-curricular opportunities available to ECE students at Georgia Tech? [/INST] ECE students have access to various student organizations, research programs like the VIP and ORS Program, undergraduate research opportunities, co-curricular initiatives like the TIES program, ESI, Create-X, and the Grand Challenges program. </s>

<s>[INST] How can ECE students at Georgia Tech take advantage of the InVenture Prize? [/INST] The InVenture Prize is an innovation competition open to all undergraduates, where students can develop and present their inventions, potentially leading to startup opportunities. </s>

<s>[INST] What does the ECE Transfer Initiative for Engineering Scholars (TIES) at Georgia Tech offer? [/INST] TIES provides support to students transferring from two- and four-year schools into electrical or computer engineering majors, offering enrichment programs and scholarships funded by the NSF S-STEM Program. </s>

<s>[INST] How do students make an appointment to see an ECE advisor at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Students can schedule an appointment with an ECE advisor through AdvisorLink, checking available time slots and the location (office or online) of the appointment. </s>

<s>[INST] Are walk-in appointments allowed for ECE undergraduate advising at Georgia Tech? [/INST] No, walk-in appointments are not allowed. Students must schedule an appointment to see an ECE undergraduate academic advisor or can email their queries to the undergraduate office. </s>

<s>[INST] How can students decide which threads to choose in the ECE program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Students should explore each thread and select the two that most interest them and align with their post-graduation plans. Information about each thread and related career paths is provided in ECE1100. </s>

<s>[INST] Where can students find assistance in making a 4-year academic plan for graduation in ECE at Georgia Tech? [/INST] ECE provides 8-semester plans for every thread combination for both BSEE and BSCMPE degrees, available on the Georgia Tech ECE website. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the process for changing a major to Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Students must complete the change of major form for undergraduate students through the Registrar’s DocuSign application, which is then approved by both the new and current major's advisors. </s>

<s>[INST] How do transfer students outside of ECE change their major to EE or CMPE at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Non-majors must be enrolled for one semester, have a minimum GPA of 2.70, meet specific course requirements, and complete the change of major form, meeting Georgia Tech Admissions requirements. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the process for declaring a minor in the ECE program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] To declare a minor, students must send the minor form through DocuSign to be signed by the minor school and their major school. Some minors may require an additional application. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the minimum GPA requirement to meet ECE degree requirements at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Students must earn a C or better in all CS, MATH, PHYS, and ECE required courses, including any required courses from a chosen thread, and maintain a minimum GPA of 2.0 to graduate. </s>

<s>[INST] Which courses can ECE students at Georgia Tech take on a pass-fail basis? [/INST] ECE students can take humanities, social sciences (except ECON), science electives, and approved/free electives on a pass-fail basis. Certain ECE courses like ECE 1100 and ECE 3005 are also offered only on a pass-fail basis. </s>

<s>[INST] How does research contribute to an ECE degree at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Students can use up to 6 hours of research towards FREE electives. If opting for the research option with a thesis, 9 hours can count towards the degree, with specific allocations for EE thread electives and FREE electives. </s>

<s>[INST] What undergraduate degrees are offered by the School of Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The School of ECE at Georgia Tech offers undergraduate degrees in Electrical Engineering (EE) and Computer Engineering (CMPE). </s>

<s>[INST] What are 'threads' in the context of Georgia Tech's ECE program? [/INST] 'Threads' are specialized paths within the ECE curriculum that allow students to focus on specific areas of interest in Electrical and Computer Engineering, combining flexibility with depth in the subject. </s>

<s>[INST] Can Georgia Tech ECE students study abroad, and how does it fit into their curriculum? [/INST] Yes, ECE students at Georgia Tech can participate in study abroad programs, which can be integrated into their curriculum through the International Plan or other exchange programs, offering global exposure and learning. </s>

<s>[INST] What are some examples of student organizations related to ECE at Georgia Tech? [/INST] ECE students at Georgia Tech can join various student organizations, such as the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) and Women in ECE (WECE). </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Grand Challenges Living Learning Community at Georgia Tech? [/INST] It's a program that encourages student-driven, cross-disciplinary teams to work on societally relevant technological and sociological problems, open to all entering Georgia Tech students of any major. </s>

<s>[INST] What is unique about Georgia Tech's CREATE-X program? [/INST] CREATE-X at Georgia Tech is a unique set of programs designed to foster entrepreneurial confidence in students, providing tools and support to establish startups. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the focus of the Opportunity Research Scholars (ORS) Program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The ORS Program at Georgia Tech matches undergraduate electrical and computer engineering students with Ph.D. mentors to work on structured research projects, along with attending enrichment workshops. </s>

<s>[INST] How does the Vertically Integrated Projects (VIP) Program benefit undergraduates at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The VIP Program offers a unique way for undergraduates to earn academic credits by participating in faculty-led research teams, bridging the gap between undergraduate education and faculty research. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the ECE Transfer Initiative for Engineering Scholars (TIES) at Georgia Tech? [/INST] TIES is a program supported by the NSF to help students transferring into electrical or computer engineering, offering both an enrichment program and scholarships. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the significance of the Engineering for Social Innovation Center (ESI) at Georgia Tech? [/INST] ESI is dedicated to projects that aim to improve the lives of underprivileged populations, allowing undergraduates to engage in meaningful design and research for social innovation. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the National Science Foundation's (NSF) Scholarships in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (S-STEM) Program, and how is it related to Georgia Tech's ECE program? [/INST] The NSF's S-STEM Program funds scholarships at institutions like Georgia Tech, supporting students in STEM disciplines. In ECE, it supports initiatives like the TIES program, aiding students transferring into electrical or computer engineering. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the Undergraduate Professional Internship and Work Abroad programs in ECE at Georgia Tech? [/INST] These programs offer ECE students at Georgia Tech opportunities for practical work experience in their field, either domestically or abroad, complementing their academic studies without the long-term commitment of the co-op program. </s>

<s>[INST] How does Georgia Tech's ECE program support students interested in entrepreneurship? [/INST] Through initiatives like the CREATE-X program, Georgia Tech's ECE program provides students with the necessary tools and guidance to develop entrepreneurial skills and establish their startups. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the Grand Challenges Living Learning Community, and how does it integrate with Georgia Tech's ECE program? [/INST] The Grand Challenges Living Learning Community encourages interdisciplinary collaboration among Georgia Tech students to solve technological and sociological problems, complementing the ECE curriculum with practical, problem-solving experiences. </s>

<s>[INST] How does Georgia Tech's ECE program incorporate interdisciplinary learning and research? [/INST] Programs like Vertically Integrated Projects (VIP) and the Opportunity Research Scholars (ORS) integrate interdisciplinary learning and research into the ECE curriculum, allowing students to work on projects that combine different fields of study. </s>

<s>[INST] I'm looking for details about the Distributed Systems & Software Design thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Distributed Systems & Software Design thread: Software directs the countless computing devices that permeate our lives, instructing what to compute, how to assist, and coordinating the many interconnected sources of information we rely upon. This thread explores how software systems are created to do this—from controlling small scale embedded microarchitectures to large-scale data centers, and from tracking personal fitness to coordinating distributed technology in smart cities. For instance, how do we orchestrate a massive array of computers to accelerate the search for new pharmaceuticals or immunotherapies? How can we share knowledge with each other and collaborate through cloud services while maintaining consistency, accessibility, and security? How does a network of smart cameras seamlessly track an Olympic ice skater or skier during a fast-paced event? How do we coordinate geographically dispersed, interconnected devices in smart cities, farms, and forests, that balance computing locally ('on the edge') with leveraging shared information globally ('in the cloud') to achieve performance and energy efficiency? Engineers in these areas work closely with experts in computing hardware and networks to both harness the power of emerging technologies and to drive new hardware advances to meet computational needs. </s>

<s>[INST] Can you give me details about the Cybersecurity thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Cybersecurity thread: Stopping the next devastating cyberattack requires building secure systems from the bottom up. The ECE Cybersecurity thread teaches the fundamentals of secure system design and cyber defense. Courses in this thread span from building new secure hardware platforms and vulnerability analysis to malware investigation and cyberattack response. As cyberattacks continue to affect our everyday lives, this thread provides students with an increasingly in-demand skill set for careers that transcend the tech industry’s cybersecurity goals. </s>

<s>[INST] Give me information about the Computing Hardware & Emerging Architectures thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Computing Hardware & Emerging Architectures thread: The Computing Hardware and Emerging Architectures thread focuses on the physical realization of computing systems—the inner workings that compute, remember, learn, and communicate results. It deals with the challenges of making computing devices respond quickly and reliably, while being energy efficient, for example, to maximize battery life or to create environmentally sustainable data centers. It explores computing architectures that integrate millions of processing elements working in synchrony to accelerate machine learning, medical image analysis, climate modeling, and other computationally intense applications. This thread also explores new computing technologies inspired by biology and quantum physics such as neuromorphic and quantum computing. </s>

<s>[INST] I'm looking for details about the Information Internetworks thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Information Internetworks thread: The Information Internetworks thread is where computing meets data enterprise. This thread deals with implications in the context of personal and organizational information management. Information Internetworks prepares students for all levels of information management by helping them to capture, represent, organize, transform, communicate, and present data so that it becomes information, using geographically distributed multi-national organizations and information needs as contextInformation InternetworksRequiredCS 2340 - Objects and Design	3CS 3510 or CS 3511 - Design and Analysis of Algorithms	3Pick 2 from Introduction to Information ManagementCS 4235 - Introduction to Information Security	3CS 3251 - Computer Networking 1	3CS 4400 - Introduction to Database Systems	3Pick 1 from Advanced Information ManagementCS 4237 - Computer and Network Security	3CS 4251 - Computer Networking 2	3CS 4255 - Introduction to Network Management	3CS 4261 - Mobile Applications and Services for Converged Networks	3CS 4270 - Data Communications Laboratory	3CS 4365 - Introduction to Enterprise Computing	3CS 4420 - Database System Implementation	3CS 4440 - Emerging Database Technologies and Applications	3CS 4675 - Internet Computing Systems, Services, and Applications	3ChangedMonday, 28 August 2023 10:46 AM EDT </s>

<s>[INST] What are the details for the Systems & Architecture thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Systems & Architecture thread: The Systems & Architecture thread is where many of the practical skills of computing are learned. This thread teaches you about the organization of computer systems, how they are built using different hardware and software layers and how they are programmed.The Systems & Architecture thread deals with a complete vertical slice of system building from processor design, memory organization to virtualization and operating system layers all the way up to the programming interfaces, languages and the tool chains such as compilers, debuggers and profilers. It emphasizes different system properties such as performance, power consumption, reliability, security, and availability. This thread spans a vast spectrum of systems ranging from parallel and distributed systems to emerging multi-core systems, as well as domain specific systems (such as gaming consoles, healthcare information systems, real-time embedded controllers used in avionics, and so on). Systems & ArchitectureRequiredCS 2340 - Objects and Design	3CS 3210 - Design of Operating Systems	3CS 3220 - Computer Structures: HW/SW Codesign of a Processor	3CS 3510 or CS 3511 - Design and Analysis of Algorithms	3Pick 1 of Systems Software ToolsCS 3300 - Introduction to Software Engineering	3CS 4240 - Compilers, Interpreters, and Program Analyzers	3Pick 1 of Advanced Systems & ArchitectureCS 4210 - Advanced Operating Systems	3CS 4220 - Programming Embedded Systems	3ECE4100 - Advanced Computer Architecture	3ChangedMonday, 28 August 2023 10:47 AM EDT </s>

<s>[INST] Can you give me details about the Robotics and Autonomous Systems thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Robotics and Autonomous Systems thread: Physical systems may be engineered to operate automatically. Examples from our daily lives include: temperature control systems in homes; elevator control systems at work; and automotive control systems such as traction control, braking control, adaptive cruise control, and lane keeping control. All these systems combine sensing, computation, and actuation in feedback loops to achieve stable behavior and provide high performance. The Robotics and Autonomous Systems thread prepares students to apply this basic concept in diverse areas—such as space, air and ground vehicles, and robots of various types—to safely automate tasks, or work in hazardous and hostile environments, without human input. </s>

<s>[INST] Can you give me details about the Telecommunications thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Telecommunications thread: The Telecommunications thread prepares students to effectively understand how to engineer and optimize communication systems that support the ever-increasing data flows critical to our daily lives. This thread focuses on the communication engineering principles and technologies that form the backbone of the information age, from data storage to data transmission, from wireless to optics. The thread develops the mathematical and engineering principles that enable the design of interconnected systems, from the physical medium where information is encoded, to the network level where protocols are designed, using tools from applied probability to signal processing. </s>

<s>[INST] Tell me about the Signal & Information Processing thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Signal & Information Processing thread: The technology we use, and even rely on, in our everyday lives—computers, radios, video, cameras, cell phones, driverless vehicles, drones—is enabled by signal and information processing, a branch of electrical engineering that models and analyzes data representations of physical events. Signal and information processing is at the heart of our modern world, powering today’s entertainment and tomorrow’s technology. It’s at the intersection of biotechnology and social interactions. It enhances our ability to communicate and share information, between humans, between humans and machines, or between machines. Signal and information processing is behind every aspect of our digital lives.Over the past six decades, the types of signals and the functionalities on which this branch of science has focused have broadened to include radar signals, geophysical signals, audio, speech, music, images, videos, 3D graphics, social network data, biomedical data, bio signals, and more. Sensors feed data into a signal and information processing module that interprets the captured data and enables visualization, analysis, manipulation, and control for the SIP engineer. The discipline includes several applications of math and principles of electrical engineering to represent signals and information in ways that are beneficial for the application at hand. In today’s applications, you will find SIP in your mobile phone representing your images and videos via compression and analytics, in autonomous vehicles providing an understanding of the surrounding environment for safe and effective driving experience by machines, in healthcare establishments imaging our bodies and brains, in energy companies, and in every social media platform. Signal and information processing is the core of today’s artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning, previously known as pattern recognition. Have you shared "what’s on your mind” with social media friends or video chatted with family today? These are just two of the many ways we use machine learning every day. Machine learning and SIP bring together mathematics, computer science, and statistics to harness predictive power, and provide the technology behind other applications, including detecting credit card fraud, medical diagnostics, stock market analysis, speech recognition, and video understanding. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the details for the Bioengineering thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Bioengineering thread: The recent events in the US and across the world have again highlighted the critical role of technology in addressing major societal problems in health. Learning about the intersection between engineering and health can help you create the next generation of diagnostic devices for viral infections, design inexpensive physiological monitoring tools to broaden healthcare accessibility in medically underserved populations, implement digital health approaches for deriving disease biomarkers from patients without the need for expensive lab tests or physician visits, conceive machine learning algorithms for deriving clinically-relevant information from large amounts of health data, and address many other exciting and topical problems. This thread explores the intersection between electrical and computer engineering (ECE) and health/biosciences to equip you with what you need to succeed in a bioengineering career. </s>

<s>[INST] Give me information about the Sensing & Exploration thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Sensing & Exploration thread: We naturally develop an incredible ability to sense our surroundings and then communicate via those senses. We ask our engineering tools to do the same, and the Sensing and Exploration thread is all about making that happen. How do radars detect raindrops 100 miles away and distinguish them from snow or a flock of birds? How do we still receive messages from a satellite that has escaped the solar system? How are driverless cars and robots able to “see” their surroundings? What can medical sensors observe about the state of a person? How do we navigate known spaces and explore new spaces with these sensors? This thread explores the intellectual challenges that underlie this critical engineering need. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the details for the Electric Energy Systems thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Electric Energy Systems thread: Access to clean, reliable, and inexpensive electrical power is key for achieving an economically competitive, environmentally sustainable, and healthier society. Our daily lives depend on electricity more than ever before. Advancements in the production, distribution, and use of electrical power and energy are required to enable decarbonization and electrification of the transportation and industrial sectors, and digitalization of our economy. Parallel developments in information and digital control technologies enable the complex operations of the resulting smart grid in a cyber-secure environment. This thread explores power systems and markets, smart grids, power electronics, electric machines, dielectric materials, end use technologies, and secure protection and control approaches to creatively contribute to the transformation of the electric energy sector and enable career paths in the areas outlined below. </s>

<s>[INST] Give me information about the Electronic & Optoelectronic Devices thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Electronic & Optoelectronic Devices thread: In the hierarchy of electronics and optoelectronics, spanning from devices to systems, functional stand-alone collections of circuits are known as systems. Thus, devices are the smallest and most fundamental element of this hierarchy. Device design is the most basic element and skill needed in the optoelectronics/electronics industry and as the devices most often limit performance such as speed, power efficiency, or behavior, knowledge of device design and manufacture is critically sought by industry. Systems are analogous to the human body. The circuits are analogous to the heart and the devices analogous to the heart muscle cells, i.e. the core building block of the entire system/body. But unlike the human body, we have control of the design of the device allowing it to be made faster, more power efficient, or even the ability to create new devices with new behaviors. The Electronic & Optical Devices thread prepares you for a career designing and manufacturing nano-scale devices that for example, are used in complex circuitry to perform some desired function such as computation, sensing, control, communications, and amplification, among countless other functions.Unlike other threads that focus exclusively on one functionality using pre-made device “components” outside your control, this thread provides detailed understanding of device operational principles, design methods, and methods and limitations in manufacturing these devices that allow you to understand how to make new or improve on existing devices. As all circuits use optoelectronic/electronics devices, it is broadly applicable and marketable. </s>

<s>[INST] Give me information about the Circuit Technology thread? [/INST] Here is some information about the Circuit Technology thread: In the hierarchy of electronics, spanning from devices to systems, functional stand-alone collections of circuits are known as systems. Thus, circuit design is the core element and skill needed to take individual electronic devices (elements that do some rudimentary function on current and voltage) and supply functionality to create systems. Systems are analogous to the human body. The circuits are analogous to the heart and the devices analogous to the heart muscle cells, i.e. the core building block of the entire system/body. But unlike the human body, we have control over how these devices are arranged and interact via circuit design, creating new functionality or improving on prior performance. The Circuits Technology thread prepares you for a career designing and manufacturing both nano-scale (small circuits written collectively onto a tiny “chip”) and component level (typically large pre-packaged devices soldered together on a board) complex circuitry to perform some desired function such as computation, sensing, control, communications, and amplification, among countless other functions. Unlike other threads that focus exclusively on one electronics functionality, this thread provides the detailed understanding of design and circuit operation applicable to a wide range of applications. It is the most broadly applicable and marketable of all the circuit application threads. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the ECE Graduate Handbook? [/INST] The ECE Graduate Handbook provides information about ECE’s graduate degree programs as well as the policies and procedures of the School. It aims to familiarize ECE graduate students with degree program requirements, policies, procedures, and available resources. </s>

<s>[INST] What welcome message does the Chair of the Georgia Tech School of Electrical and Computer Engineering extend to new students? [/INST] The Chair welcomes new students to one of the nation's best ECE programs, highlighting the school's commitment to supporting students in their studies and professional ethics. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the key elements of the Honor Code at Georgia Tech's School of Electrical and Computer Engineering? [/INST] The Honor Code includes expectations of professionalism, academic honesty, integrity, and specific behaviors such as respecting others, avoiding cheating, and being honest in all academic endeavors. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the primary functions of the ECE Graduate Affairs Office? [/INST] The ECE Graduate Affairs Office processes admissions, makes recommendations for financial assistance, maintains student files, coordinates thesis and dissertation committees, processes petitions and applications for degrees, monitors assistantships, and provides academic advisement. </s>

<s>[INST] Are faculty advisors required for all ECE graduate students? [/INST] Faculty advisors are not required for students pursuing a non-thesis master's degree. However, Ph.D. and M.S. students choosing the thesis option must have research advisors. </s>

<s>[INST] When should M.S. thesis option students select their research advisor? [/INST] M.S. thesis option students should select a research advisor during their first term and no later than the end of registration for their second term in residence. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the registration process for new students in the ECE graduate program? [/INST] New students must attend mandatory advisement sessions held prior to each term. Registration for classes is conducted online through the OSCAR system. </s>

<s>[INST] What happens to students whose grades fall below the minimum required by the Institute? [/INST] Students with grades below the minimum face academic standings of 'Warning,' 'Probation,' 'Review,' or 'Dismissal,' and will be contacted by the Associate Chair for Graduate Affairs for academic performance discussions. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the degree requirements for the M.S.E.C.E. program? [/INST] The M.S.E.C.E. program requires 30 credit hours, divided among ECE 6000 level classes, elective hours, and, for the thesis option, M.S. Thesis Research. </s>

<s>[INST] What does the Master of Science in Cybersecurity program entail? [/INST] The M.S. in Cybersecurity requires 32 credit hours, including core courses, a Cyber-Physical Systems track, and electives, with a focus on various aspects of cybersecurity. </s>

It is intended to familiarize ECE graduate students with program requirements, policies, procedures, and resources available through the ECE Graduate Affairs Office and other administrative offices at Georgia Tech. </s>

<s>[INST] What welcome message does the Chair of the Georgia Tech School of Electrical and Computer Engineering extend to new students? <s>[INST] What are the key principles of the Honor Code at the Georgia Tech School of Electrical and Computer Engineering? <s>[INST] What are the functions of the ECE Graduate Affairs Office at Georgia Tech? <s>[INST] Are faculty advisors mandatory for all graduate students in ECE at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Faculty advisors are not required for students pursuing a non-thesis master's degree. However, Ph.D. students and M.S. students opting for the thesis must have research advisors. </s>

<s>[INST] When should M.S. thesis option students at Georgia Tech select their research advisor? [/INST] M.S. thesis option students should select a research advisor during their first term and no later than the end of registration for their second term in residence. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the academic standing categories for ECE students at Georgia Tech? <s>[INST] What does the M.S. in Cybersecurity program at Georgia Tech entail? <s>[INST] What are the requirements for the M.S.E.C.E. degree at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The M.S.E.C.E. degree requires 30 credit hours, including 9-12 hours in ECE 6000 level classes within one or two Technical Interest Areas (TIAs), 9-12 hours in ECE 6000 level classes outside the chosen TIAs, 3-9 hours in elective courses, and 3 hours in Technology Entrepreneurship. For the thesis option, 12 hours of M.S. Thesis Research are included. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the general requirements for a master’s degree in ECE at Georgia Tech? [/INST] A minimum grade of 'C' is required in all classes. Students must maintain a minimum GPA of 2.70 to graduate and remain in 'Good' academic standing. No more than 9 hours of 4000 level courses and certain courses like ECE 8900, 8997, 8998, 8999, and 9000 cannot be used to satisfy degree requirements. </s>

<s>[INST] Can students switch from the thesis to the non-thesis option in the M.S.E.C.E. program at Georgia Tech? <s>[INST] What are the requirements for the Master of Science in Cybersecurity degree at Georgia Tech? The program covers technology and policy dimensions of cybersecurity. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the expected timeline for completing the M.S.E.C.E. degree at Georgia Tech? This timeline may include an internship semester. </s>

<s>[INST] How can M.S. students at Georgia Tech transfer to the Ph.D. program? <s>[INST] What are the requirements for the Ph.D. degree in ECE at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The Ph.D. degree requires 43 credit hours of coursework, Responsible Conduct of Research training, a residency requirement, passing the Ph.D. Comprehensive Exam, including the Proposal Exam, and successfully defending a dissertation. </s>

<s>[INST] What coursework is required for the Ph.D. degree in ECE at Georgia Tech? <s>[INST] What is Group III in the Ph.D. program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Group III consists of 9 credit hours in a minor discipline outside of ECE. <s>[INST] Can students switch from the thesis to the non-thesis option in the M.S.E.C.E. program at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Students can switch from the thesis to the non-thesis option with their advisor's agreement but cannot count any of the thesis hours towards the non-thesis degree requirements. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the requirements for the Master of Science in Cybersecurity degree at Georgia Tech? [/INST] The M.S. in Cybersecurity requires 32 credit hours, including core courses, a Cyber-Physical Systems track, electives, and a 5-credit practicum project course. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the recommended completion timeline for a non-thesis M.S.E.C.E. student at Georgia Tech? [/INST] A full-time non-thesis M.S.E.C.E. student should complete all degree requirements in a maximum of three semesters, or four semesters if participating in the Internship program. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the requirements for M.S. students at Georgia Tech to switch to the Ph.D. program? [/INST] M.S. students wishing to switch to the Ph.D. program must pass the Ph.D. Coursework Qualifier, find a research advisor, have a funding source, maintain a 3.5 GPA, and submit required documents for approval. </s>

<s>[INST] When should M.S. thesis option students at Georgia Tech select their research advisor? [/INST] M.S. thesis option students should select a research advisor during their first term and no later than the end of registration for their second term in residence. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the registration structure for new ECE graduate students at Georgia Tech? [/INST] New ECE graduate students must attend mandatory advisement sessions before each term. Registration for classes is online through Georgia Tech's OSCAR system. </s>

<s>[INST] What are common registration restrictions for ECE students at Georgia Tech? [/INST] Students may face registration restrictions due to academic or administrative decisions. A permit must be issued by the unit that placed the registration restriction before registration is possible. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the requirements for an ECE M.S. degree? [/INST] For the ECE M.S. degree, you need: 

- 6 hours of 6000 level or higher ECE classes in 1 or 2 Technical Interest Areas for Group I
- 6 hours of 6000 level or higher ECE classes outside the TIAs chosen for Group I for Group II
- 3 hours of electives at the 4000 level or above
- 3 hours of Technology Entrepreneurship 
- 12 hours of M.S. Thesis research if choosing the thesis option

For a total of 30 hours. Additional details on specific course and grade requirements can be found in the graduate handbook.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I change my advisor while pursuing my Ph.D.? [/INST] Yes, you are able to change your Ph.D. advisor if necessary. However, this decision should not be made lightly. You are encouraged to first meet with the Associate Chair for Graduate Affairs for guidance before officially changing advisors. While one change of advisor is understandable, multiple changes can negatively impact your funding eligibility and progress.</s>

<s>[INST] When do I need to submit my Ph.D. proposal? [/INST] You must successfully complete your Ph.D. proposal exam by the end of your 7th semester after starting an ECE graduate program at Georgia Tech, not including summers. There are specific guidelines on the format, content, and process for the proposal that you can find in the graduate handbook. In general, you submit a written report followed by an oral presentation to your committee.</s>

<s>[INST] What classes count as pass/fail electives? [/INST] The only pass/fail courses you can use as electives are ECE seminars (ECE 8001, 8002, 8022, 7721, and 6792), CS/CSE seminars (CS/CSE 800x), and the RCR requirement PHIL 6000. Note that a maximum of 3 pass/fail hours can be used in the non-thesis M.S. and only 4 pass/fail hours total for the Ph.D. Additional restrictions apply on where they can fulfill requirements, so check the handbook.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I go on internship while pursuing my Ph.D.? [/INST] Yes, Ph.D. students are allowed an unlimited number of summer internship terms. You can also do one semester long internship during the fall or spring, but you need permission from the Associate Chair first. If you have a GRA, you need to coordinate the internship plan with your advisor as well.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the minimum GPA required for an ECE M.S. degree? [/INST] The minimum GPA to graduate with an ECE M.S. degree is 2.70. Since GT does not round GPAs, a 2.67 would not be sufficient. You also need at least a 2.70 cumulative GPA to remain in good academic standing.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I use special problems courses for my Ph.D. electives? [/INST] Yes, you can use up to 6 hours of ECE or CS special problems courses (8901, 8902, 8903) toward the general electives portion (Group IV). They cannot be used to fulfill other group requirements. You need prior approval and validation that the work is PhD-level.</s>

<s>[INST] When should I start looking for a faculty advisor? [/INST] You should start identifying potential faculty advisors early, even before passing the qualifier exam. Official selection should occur shortly after passing the qualifier, by submitting the PhD advisor selection form online.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I pursue a graduate certificate along with my ECE degree? [/INST] Yes, we encourage students to complete multidisciplinary certificates, such as Technology Innovation & Entrepreneurship. The certificate courses can often double-count towards your ECE electives. Check with an advisor on specifics.</s>

<s>[INST] How long do I have to complete my PhD after passing the proposal exam? [/INST] Institute policy requires you finish all PhD requirements within 7 years of passing the comprehensive exam, which is the proposal exam in ECE. So you have 7 years from passing your proposal to graduate.</s>

<s>[INST] What happens if I don't graduate in the term I applied for? [/INST] Your graduation application does not automatically roll over! After about 10 days, you'll need to reapply on OSCAR for graduation in the next term.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I pursue research abroad for my PhD? [/INST] Yes, we have opportunities to conduct research towards your ECE PhD abroad at our campus in Metz, France (GTL) or our campus in Shenzhen, China (GT-Shenzhen).</s>

<s>[INST] How many hours should I register for as a GRA? [/INST] If you are a GRA you should register for 21 hours in fall/spring and 16 hours in summer. The additional hours beyond full-time should be research credits (9000 PhD, 7000 MS).</s>

<s>[INST] When should I apply for graduation? [/INST] All students should submit the Online Application for Graduation (OAG) through OSCAR no later than the deadline set by the ECE Academic Office, typically early in the term.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the best way to contact the Graduate Office? [/INST] The best way is to email us through the “Contact Us” form on the ECE website. You can also call, come during office hours, or request an appointment if needed.</s>

<s>[INST] What classes are restricted during Phase I registration? [/INST] All ECE graduate classes are restricted to ECE majors only during Phase I. This ensures ECE students can register for our classes before other majors.</s>

<s>[INST] When should I submit my Masters Coursework Form? [/INST] Your complete coursework plan for the MS degree must be submitted no later than the deadline set by the ECE Academic Office, typically early in your final graduating term.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I enroll in multiple Georgia Tech campuses simultaneously? [/INST] No, the registration system is designed so you can only take classes associated with one GT campus per term - either Atlanta, France, China, or Online.</s>

<s>[INST] What happens if my GPA falls below 3.0? [/INST] According to Institute policy, any PhD student whose overall GPA falls below 3.0 will no longer be in good academic standing. You would be placed on academic probation or warning.</s>

<s>[INST] When should I file my Notice of Absence? [/INST] If traveling away from campus during non-break times, or longer than a scheduled break, you must submit the ECE Notice of Absence form found on the forms section of the ECE website.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I pursue an internship while on OPT? [/INST] Students approved for Optional Practical Training (OPT) may pursue paid internships or employment in their field of study without needing additional authorization.</s>

<s>[INST] How many credit hours can I transfer to my PhD? [/INST] Up to 30 credit hours from a completed graduate degree, like a Masters, can be applied toward the ECE PhD coursework requirements, if approved.</s>

<s>[INST] When is the earliest I can apply for BS-MS? [/INST] You can apply to the joint BSMS program as early as your sophomore year if you are an EE/CmpE undergrad. Spring admits apply fall of sophomore year.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I take a semester leave of absence from my program? [/INST] Yes, with approval you may take one non-summer semester leave for an internship. Additional leave requests require permission from the Associate Chair.</s>

<s>[INST] Who issues official verification of my GRA employment? [/INST] The Office of Human Resources handles official employment verification. You can request documentation by visiting their website.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the deadline for withdrawing from classes? [/INST] The withdrawal or 'drop' deadline is posted on the official academic calendar. It is typically a few days after midterms, around the 7th week of classes.</s>

<s>[INST] When should I submit my PhD dissertation to my committee?  [/INST] You should submit your completed dissertation draft to your reading committee with enough time for them to review it - at minimum 2 weeks, but preferably 1 month prior to your defense date.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I pursue a distance learning degree if I'm on campus? [/INST] Current on-campus students wishing to switch to the fully online ECE MS degree should first request permission by contacting the distance learning program coordinator.</s>

<s>[INST] How many credit hours can I take maximum? [/INST] The maximum hours you can register for in fall/spring is 21 hours. For summer it is 16 hours. Attempting more requires an approved petition.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I enroll in undergraduate pre-requisite courses? [/INST] Yes, you can request permission to enroll in undergraduate pre-reqs not previously taken, but note no more than 9 hours total of 4000-level classes apply to ECE graduate degrees.</s>

<s>[INST] What happens if I don't finish my PhD within 7 years? [/INST] If you exceed the 7 year deadline, you may apply for a waiver to continue. However, it's not guaranteed, and you must have a concrete plan for finishing if granted an extension.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I pursue a graduate internship abroad? [/INST] Unfortunately graduate internships outside the US cannot be processed. International students can pursue CPT employment abroad after being enrolled for 9 months.</s>

<s>[INST] How do I obtain permission for time conflicts? [/INST] If you get a time conflict trying to register for two overlapping courses, you can obtain signed permission from both instructors on the time conflict form to enroll.</s>

<s>[INST] Where can I hold assistantships outside ECE? [/INST] You may be hired as a GRA/GTA in other graduate programs, but the hiring department must report your appointment to the ECE Academic Office.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I enroll if I already finished my degree requirements? [/INST] Yes, you can apply for an enrollment waiver to graduate without being enrolled if you complete all requirements before next term registration closes.</s>

<s>[INST] What happens if I'm not registered properly as GRA/GTA? [/INST] You MUST maintain full-time enrollment to keep your assistantship and waiver. If not, you will lose both and be charged tuition so register properly!</s>

<s>[INST] When are graduate classes offered abroad? [/INST] The full-time ECE graduate programs offered at GTL in France and GT Shenzhen in China provide Georgia Tech ECE classes taught by GT faculty on-site.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I pursue another Georgia Tech master’s degree simultaneously? [/INST] Yes, you can pursue dual master's degrees either within or external to ECE if you inform both academic programs early in your studies.</s>

<s>[INST] How long does it take to get a teaching assignment? [/INST] If hired as a GTA, your teaching assignment for the upcoming semester will typically be provided over the summer break prior to the start of classes.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I return to school after an unauthorized break? [/INST] If you take an unauthorized break for over 2 semesters, you will need to apply for readmission on the registrar's website before returning.</s>
<s>[INST] Where can I hold my student mailbox? [/INST] Graduate students must use their local address or rent a mailbox at the campus post office. Mail cannot be delivered to the school.</s>
<s>[INST] How do I submit permit requests? [/INST] Students can submit requests for ECE registration permits online through the permit/overload request system found on the ECE website.</s>

<s>[INST] When should I submit my degree petition? [/INST] Your degree petition must be submitted to the registrar's office no later than the second week of classes in your final graduating semester.</s>

<s>[INST] Who should I contact about institute tuition and fee matters?  [/INST] You would contact the Bursar's Office directly regarding any student account, billing, tuition, fee or refund questions.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the best way to contact my academic advisor? [/INST] The best way is to email your assigned advisor directly during advising office hours, or request an appointment if needed.</s>
<s>[INST] What classes can I take pass/fail? [/INST] Only certain seminars and the RCR course PHIL 6000 qualify for pass/fail credit. ECE courses must be taken for letter grade.</s>

<s>[INST] When should I submit my degree petition? [/INST] Master’s students should submit their degree petition form to the Registrar's Office no later than the second week of classes in your final graduating term.</s>
<s>[INST] Who approves my minor courses? [/INST] Your intended minor courses are approved by the ECE Graduate Affairs Office when you submit your online PhD Coursework Plan for verification.</s>
<s>[INST] Can I pursue a semester co-op during my degree? [/INST] Yes, the Career Discovery Graduate Co-op program allows course credit for a semester long, paid, degree-related work term.</s>
<s>[INST] Do I need to reapply for graduation if I miss my term? [/INST] Yes, after your first graduation application expires you must reapply on OSCAR for graduation in the next term.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the requirement for full-time enrollment? [/INST] Full-time is 12 credits minimum, with at least 9 hours on letter grade or pass/fail basis. This applies to GTAs, GRAs, and visa holders.</s>

<s>[INST] When is the deadline for withdrawing from all classes? [/INST] The withdraw deadline is later than the drop deadline, but you still must withdraw yourself electronically through OSCAR by that date.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I take undergraduate classes as a graduate student? [/INST] Yes, you can request permission to enroll in undergraduate classes if needed to fulfill prerequisites that you haven't previously completed.</s>

<s>[INST] How many credit hours can I transfer to my Masters? [/INST] You may be able to transfer up to 6 credit hours of relevant graduate coursework from another accredited US institution to your MS degree.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I still travel abroad if my visa is expiring? [/INST] No, your student visa must remain valid for the entire period you are abroad. Meet with OIE early to coordinate travel with visa renewal.</s>

<s>[INST] When should I submit my thesis topic approval form? [/INST] Master’s thesis students should submit their signed topic approval form after presenting research progress to their committee, typically midway through the thesis.</s>
<s>[INST] Where can I find a list of ECE research positions? [/INST] Available PhD research positions with ECE faculty are posted at https://researchopportunities.ece.gatech.edu.</s>
<s>[INST] Who approves taking undergraduate classes? [/INST] Graduate students need permission from ECE’s undergraduate advisors to enroll in undergraduate lecture courses.</s>
<s>[INST] Am I allowed to have two advisors? [/INST] Yes, having a co-advisor in addition to your main PhD advisor is allowed and quite common for interdisciplinary research topics.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I still travel after withdrawing from classes? [/INST] Students who fully withdraw are expected to remain out of school the next term, so travel could impact your registration hold and visas.</s>
<s>[INST] When should I begin filing internship paperwork? [/INST] You should start filing internship applications with the Career Center early the semester prior to your planned work term.</s>

<s>[INST] Can I pursue a distance learning and thesis MS simultaneously? [/INST] No, you can only be enrolled in one 'version' of the MS program. Switching between distance and thesis options is generally not allowed.</s>
<s>[INST] How many credit hours can count double towards BS and MS? [/INST] Up to 6 credit hours can be used towards both your undergraduate ECE degree and MS degree requirements.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the best way to apply for scholarships and fellowships? [/INST] The graduate studies website has extensive information on available fellowships and the associated application processes.</s>
<s>[INST] Where can I research professor specialty areas? [/INST] The ECE website details faculty areas of research interest which can help in identifying a potential thesis or PhD advisor.</s>

<s>[INST] Am I allowed to take research credits without an advisor? [/INST] MS and PhD research courses require having an approved faculty advisor with one exception: ECE 8999 for early-stage students.</s>

<s>[INST] What electives are recommended for machine learning focus? [/INST] Good ECE electives for machine learning include pattern recognition, data science analytics, probabilistic models, and statistical learning courses.</s>
<s>[INST] Who handles institute enrollment verification? [/INST] All institute enrollment verification requests should be submitted through the Office of the Registrar.</s>

<s>[INST] Where can I find research and teaching assistant job postings? [/INST] GRA research positions are posted at https://researchopportunities.ece.gatech.edu. GTA hiring is coordinated internally by the Graduate Office.</s>

<s>[INST] What courses are required in the first year for the Bachelors of Science in Electrical Engineering with the Robotics & Autonomous Systems and Circuit Technology concentration? [/INST] In the first year fall semester, required courses are CHEM 1310, CS 1301, ECE 1100, ENGL 1101, MATH 1551, and MATH 1554. In the first year spring semester, required courses are ECE 2020, ENGL 1102, MATH 1552, PHYS 2211, and a History/Government Elective.</s>

<s>[INST] How many credit hours are required to graduate with a Bachelors of Science in Computer Engineering in the Cybersecurity and Information Internetworks concentration? [/INST] 129 total credit hours are required to graduate with a Bachelors of Science in Computer Engineering in the Cybersecurity and Information Internetworks concentration.</s>

<s>[INST] What courses should I take in the third year fall semester if I am pursuing the Bachelors of Science in Electrical Engineering with the Bioengineering and Electrical Energy Systems concentration? [/INST] The recommended courses for the third year fall semester are: ECE 3040, ECE 3043, ECE 3025, a Probability & Statistics Elective, APPH 1040 OR APPH 1050, and a Humanities Elective.</s>

<s>[INST] Does the Bachelors of Science in Electrical Engineering curriculum with the Electronic Devices and Electrical Energy Systems concentration require taking any Economics or Social Science electives? If so, when? [/INST] Yes, students in the Electronic Devices and Electrical Energy Systems concentration are required to take an Economics/Social Science Elective in the second year fall semester.</s>

<s>[INST] What math courses are required in the first year for students pursuing the Bachelors of Science in Computer Engineering degree? [/INST] The math courses required in the first year are MATH 1551, MATH 1554 in the fall semester and MATH 1552 in the spring semester.</s>

<s>[INST] How many credit hours are taken in the second year spring semester for the Circuit Technology and Electrical Energy Systems concentration under the Electrical Engineering major? [/INST] 16 credit hours are taken in the second year spring semester for the Circuit Technology and Electrical Energy Systems concentration under the Electrical Engineering major.</s>

<s>[INST] What are the options for the Probability and Statistics elective required in the third year fall semester for the Bioengineering and Sensing & Exploration concentration in Electrical Engineering? [/INST] The curriculum documentation does not specify the options for the Probability & Statistics elective. It simply lists it as a 'Prob & Stat Elective' that students in this concentration need to take in the third year fall semester.</s>

<s>[INST] Does the Computer Engineering degree with the Computing Hardware & Emerging Architectures and Information Internetworks concentration require any Humanities electives? [/INST] Yes, the Computer Engineering degree with the Computing Hardware & Emerging Architectures and Information Internetworks concentration requires two Humanities electives, one taken in the fall semester of the third year and one in the spring semester of the third year.</s>

<s>[INST] What courses are students pursuing the Bachelors of Science in Electrical Engineering with the Robotics & Autonomous Systems and Bioengineering concentration required to take in their fourth year spring semester? [/INST] In their fourth year spring semester, students in this concentration are required to take the Senior Design Sequence course, an ECE 3000/4000 Elective, and 3 courses consisting of elective hours. They also must take one course from the list of Robotics & Autonomous Systems topics and one from the list of Bioengineering topics.</s>

<s>[INST] Does the Cybersecurity and Signal & Information Processing concentration under the Computer Engineering major require an Economics or Social Science elective? [/INST] Yes, students in the Cybersecurity and Signal & Information Processing concentration under the Computer Engineering major are required to take an Economics/Social Science elective in the spring semester of their third year.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the total credit hour requirement for graduating with a Bachelors Degree in Computer Engineering concentrating in Distributed System & Software Design and Information Internetworks? [/INST] Students concentrating in Distributed System & Software Design and Information Internetworks are required to complete 129 total credit hours to graduate with a Bachelors in Computer Engineering.</s>

<s>[INST] In the spring semester of second year, which courses are taken by students pursuing the Bioengineering and Electrical Energy Systems concentration under Electrical Engineering major? [/INST] In the spring semester of second year, students pursuing the Bioengineering and Electrical Energy Systems concentration take ECE 2031, ECE 2035 or ECE 2036, ECE 2040, MATH 2551, and a Science Elective.</s>

<s>[INST] For the Electrical Engineering degree with the Circuit Technology and Bioengineering concentration, what options exist for the Science elective course in the second year spring semester? [/INST] The curriculum documentation does not specify the options for the Science elective required in the second year spring semester for this concentration. It is simply labeled 'Science Elective' without listing specific course options.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the required first year course plan for students pursuing the Bachelors of Science in Electrical Engineering degree? [/INST] In the fall semester of the first year, students take CHEM 1310, CS 1301, ECE 1100, ENGL 1101, MATH 1551, and MATH 1554. In the spring, they take ECE 2020, ENGL 1102, MATH 1552, PHYS 2211, and a History/Government elective.</s>

<s>[INST] For the Computer Engineering degree concentrating in Cybersecurity and Distributed System & Software Design, what courses are required in the fall semester of the second year? [/INST] In the fall semester of the second year, required courses are: MATH 2550, PHYS 2212, CS 1332, ECE 2020, CS 2050 OR CS 2051, and APPH 1040 OR APPH 1050.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the required course load in credit hours for the spring semester of the third year under the Telecommunications and Sensing & Exploration concentration for Electrical Engineering majors? [/INST] The required course load for the spring semester of the third year under the Telecommunications and Sensing & Exploration concentration is 16 credit hours.</s>

<s>[INST] What concentration requires taking the courses ECE 3550 and ECE 4550 under the Electrical Engineering curriculum?
